result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry D Dyson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. No contact with the victim T.M.H. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Ct 1 GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: Ct 1 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
2 year probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 days Racine County Jail STAYED
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with the victim T.M.H.
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for CIP
Defendant is eligible for SAP.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim TH (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.No contact with the address 1222 11th street (person, property, residence or family).

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Larry D Dyson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn appeared by video for Larry D Dyson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. 
Defense moves to dismiss count 1 for reasons stated on the record.
The State argues against dismissal and gives reasoning.
BTC: Motion denied, probable cause found.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
